<gallery widths="300" heights="300">
File:HSD chronic02.png
</gallery>Injection-free CT scan showing a peri-cerebral collection in the left hemispheric convexity (arrows), mostly hypo-dense, in the shape of a "crescent moon" (concave medially and convex laterally): chronic subdural haematoma. Note the additional presence of a few spontaneously hyper-dense areas within the chronic subdural haematoma, indicating the presence of a recent rebleed.

question.title: What is the characteristic shape of a chronic subdural hematoma shown in a CT scan?
question.description: A chronic subdural hematoma appears as a crescent-shaped collection in the brain

option_a.title: Crescent moon shape
option_a.description: A crescent-shaped collection in the brain, as described in the question

option_b.title: Lunar shape
option_b.description: A shape resembling the moon, which is a common misconception about the appearance of a chronic subdural hematoma

option_c.title: Irregular shape
option_c.description: A shape that is not regular or symmetrical, which is a common characteristic of acute subdural hematomas

option_d.title: Cone-shaped
option_d.description: A shape resembling a cone, which is not a characteristic of chronic subdural hematomas

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the answer option
